title: Secret Tool for Moving Pigs! || Setting up Kune Kune Rotational Grazing Paddock || Pastured Pigs

tasks.task: Interacting with farm animals and pets.
subtasks: Chatting with Liam about a friendly pig jumping on them.
Watching cows eat and expressing fondness for them.
Welcoming baby Bowser and attempting to coax him to see the group.
Giving walnuts and pumpkins to pigs for them to eat.
Observing chickens pecking at fallen walnuts.
Letting pigs free in a pasture while moving rotational fencing.
Feeding pigs and watching their reactions to different foods.
Luring a pig into a fence using bread.
Moving a doghouse and adjusting shelters for animals.
Observing interactions between different farm animals.
Collecting and moving walnuts from the ground into a wagon.
Setting up and moving electric fencing for rotational grazing.
Installing solar chargers for fence operation.
Planning winter shelters for pigs.
Feeding and maintaining animals’ health (e.g., considering feeding quantities).
Controlling animal movement with gates and physical barriers.
Moving and adjusting fencing materials and structures.
Inspecting and monitoring animal welfare (e.g., checking for parasites, spookiness).
Ensuring adequate shelter and water for animals.
Addressing fencing needs based on budget and time constraints.
Collecting fallen crops (pumpkins, walnuts) for animal feed.
Preparing areas for animals (e.g., setting up shelters, walls).
